statements.status_notes: The developer disputes this as a vulnerability stating that this cannot be exploited by an attacker. See https://github.com/lz4/lz4/issues/1667
Waiting for upstream fix
Marked no-dsa by Debian Security Team; see https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2025-62813
Marked no-dsa by Debian Security Team; see https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2025-7709
Waiting for upstream fix
Waiting for upstream fix
Package util-linux in Debian does build with readline support but chfn and chsh are provided by src:shadow and util-linux is configured with --disable-chfn-chsh.
Disputed by upstream as it is documented behaviour; see https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-tar/2025-08/msg00012.html
This is intended behaviour, after all tar is an archiving tool and you need to give -p as a command line flag
This CVE is disputed and not considered a security vulnerability by upstream.
This CVE is marked as unimportant and specific to configurations using SELinux, which is not applicable here.
This CVE is disputed and not considered a security vulnerability by upstream.
This CVE is marked as unimportant and specific to configurations using SELinux, which is not applicable here.

The developer disputes this as a vulnerability stating that if you give SQLite a corrupted database file and submit a query against the database, it might read parts of the database that you did not intend or expect.
Maintainer doesn't treat this as a security vulnerability

Fault injection based attacks are not within OpenSSLs threat model according to the security policy and this CVE is not treated as security bug by upstream: https://www.openssl.org/policies/general/security-policy.html
Unimportant bug in libgcrypt outside of security policy of upstream maintainer
This CVE is not a direct vulnerability in libgcrypt but in applications using it insecurely. This is not the case here.
This is deemed unimportant and not security vulnerability by the maintainer

The only viable vector for exploitation of this bug is local, if a static setuid program exists, and that program calls dlopen, then it may search LD_LIBRARY_PATH to locate the SONAME to load. No such program is present in the container image .
Uncontrolled recursion in regex processing. Maintainer disputes this as a vulnerability as it only occurs with crafted patterns.
ASLR bypass for pthread_created thread heap addresses. Vendor states ASLR bypass itself is not a vulnerability.
ASLR bypass using thread stack and heap cache. Not treated as security bug by upstream.
Requires user to explicitly run ldd on malicious ELF files. Classified as non-security bug by upstream.
Classified as non-security bug by upstream. Stack guard protection bypass is considered unimportant.
Not treated as vulnerability by upstream glibc. Listed under glibc Security Exceptions.
Standard POSIX behavior in glibc. Applications using glob need to impose limits themselves. Requires authenticated access and is considered unimportant by Debian.
This CVE is not treated as security issue by upstream; just a crash in a CLI tool.
This CVE is not treated as security issue by upstream and reflects intended behavior of the chown program.
Not exploitable in Debian, since no keyring URI is defined
Marked no-dsa by Debian Security Team; see https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2025-6141
